name: Red Goblin: Cursed Forest
description: Venture into the darkness of the Dream Forest and discover why it's now called "Cursed". Meet interesting characters in a psychological adventure, solve puzzles and learn all about the story of Red; a fire goblin that is now looking to find his master...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: Intel Pentium 4 Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Video Card supporting vertex shader 3 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or Later Processor: Inter Core i3 Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Video Card supporting vertex shader 3 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Great game if you're looking for a reason to kill yourself.

It's hard for all the wrong reasons - when you change screen, you often fall in a trap (that you couldn't foresee) : insta death. - when you jump somewhere, there is often an (invisible) trap: insta death. The only way to pass a level is by memorizing it. And not by skill. You've got to die a few times to know where are the traps and then you can go through the level.   Then the game got even more difficult (for more unfair reasons) and I abandoned it.
